nTupleTD

Class ValueFuncC4

  • java.lang.Object
    • nTupleTD.ValueFuncC4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ValueFuncC4
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Markus Thill Implementation of an learning value-function using a n-Tuple-System
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValueFuncC4

        public ValueFuncC4(TDParams tdPar)
        Generate a random set of n-Tuples

      • ValueFuncC4

        public ValueFuncC4(java.lang.Object[] nTuples,
           TDParams tdPar)
        Parameters:
        nTuples - The n-tuples can be given to this Constructor as arrays of different format
        Long[][]: List of the n-Tuples. Every single n-Tuple consists of long-masks (check bitboard-representation for further information)
        Long[]: List of the n-Tuples. Each n-Tuple is coded in one long-variable (check bitboard-representation for further information)
        Integer[][]: List of the n-Tuples. Each n-Tuple consists of the selected field-numbers (0-41)
        Integer[][][]: List of the n-Tuples. each n-Tuple consists of sampling points in the form (col, row)
        tdPar -

    • Method Detail

      • updateAlpha

        public void updateAlpha()
        adjust the learning-rate alpha

      • updateWeights

        public void updateWeights(int curPlayer,
                 long curZobr,
                 long nextZobr,
                 long[] curBoard,
                 long[] nextBoard,
                 boolean finished,
                 double reward)
        Update the weights of all n-Tuples
        Parameters:
        curPlayer - current player. Needed for the divided LUT
        curZobr - Zobrist Key of the current board. For curZobr=-1 the Index-Set to the current board will be calculated and not retreived from the hash-table
        nextZobr - Zobrist Key of the next board. For nextZobr=-1 the Index-Set to the next board will be calculated and not retreived from the hash-table.
        curBoard - Current Board
        nextBoard - Next board
        finished - true, if game is over
        reward - reward

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int curPlayer,
              long zobr,
              long[] board)
        Get the Value for a given board
        Parameters:
        curPlayer - current player. Needed for the divided LUT
        zobr - Zobrist Key of the board. For zobr=-1 the Index-Set to the board will be calculated and not retreived from the hash-table.
        board - bit-boards of both players
        Returns:
        Value for this board

      • getCellValues

        public int[][] getCellValues(long fieldP1,
                    long fieldP2)

      • countActiveWeights

        public long[] countActiveWeights(int verbose)
        Count (active) weights for the n-tuple set
        Parameters:
        verbose - 0: print nothing, 1: .. one line, 2: .. several lines
        Returns:
        a vector with three counts (sum over all n-tuples and their LUTs): [0] weights, [1] realizable states, [2] non-zero weights

      • getNTuples

        public NTupleC4[] getNTuples()
        Returns:
        All N-Tuple Objects. Each N-Tuple is created for both players. These are always directly behind each other.
